newsitem.title: CHINA: China signs deal with Amoco on drill bits.
newsitem.headline: China signs deal with Amoco on drill bits.

text.p: The China National Petroleum Corp (CNPC) has signed an agreement with Amoco Corp to manufacture and market "antiwhirl" drilling bits, Amoco said on Tuesday.

The agreement included technology transfer, software installation, training and licensing of Amoco patents relating to poly-crystalline diamond compact (PDC) bits, Amoco said. It did not give the value of the deal.
The bits would be made by the Jiangnan Rock Bit Plant of the Jiangnan Petroleum Bureau, a subsidiary of CNPC in central Hubei province, it said.
The Jiangnan plant would have worldwide rights to manufacture, sell and lease antiwhirl PDC bits based on Amoco technology, it said.

"Our technical cooperation with CNPC is part of Amoco's ongoing commitment to China," a company statement quoted Wolfgang Schollnberger, vice president of Exploration and Tehcnlogy Group, as saying. "The transfer of Amoco's antiwhirl bit technology will be mutually beneficial to both parties."
The PDC bits were designed to resist backward whirling motion thus increasing their efficiency and longevity, it said.
